free_text.Content: [b]Image formation :[/b][br/][li]Human perception.[br/][li]Cameras, optics, and projective geometry.[br/][li]Light sources, shadows, and shading.[br/][li]Measuring and sampling light.[br/][li]Color models and color encodings.[br/][b]Image Filtering :[/b][br/][li]Linear filters, convolution, and separability.[br/][li]Domain transform.[br/][li]Splines and interpolation.[br/][b]Singe-View Image Processing :[/b][br/][li]Finding interest points.[br/][li]Matching image features.[br/][b]Multi-View Image Processing :[/b][br/][li]Image stacks.[br/][li]High dynamic range.[br/][li]Extended depth of fiel.[br/][b]Estimation and Optimization :[/b][br/][li]Robust Least-Squares.[br/][li]Riemannian and HVS metrics.[br/][b]Machine Learning for Image Processing :[/b][br/][li]Classifiers and Decision Trees.[br/][li]Gaussian Processes.
free_text.Learning outcomes: Advanced classes in the fields of Image Processing, Computer Vision, Color Imaging and Computer Graphics all require mastery of a number of mathematical tools and of their implementation. Also required is an understanding the image formation and perception processes.[br/][br/]This course aims at supplying this knowledge by combining formal lectures and software development and prototyping exercises under Matlab.

free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: Les cours avancés dans les domaines de la photographie digitale, de la vision par ordinateur et du graphique requièrent la maîtrise d'un certain nombre de techniques mathématiques, de leur implémentation.
